### computeKnownBits() {#a903bd19e9d31beff55b22fe86111639e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void computeKnownBits (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; DemandedElts, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownbits">KnownBits</a> &amp; Known, unsigned Depth, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/simplifyquery">SimplifyQuery</a> &amp; Q)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Determine which bits of V are known to be either zero or one and return them in the Known bit set.

NOTE: we cannot consider &#39;undef&#39; to be &quot;IsZero&quot; here. The problem is that we cannot optimize based on the assumption that it is zero without changing it to be an explicit zero. If we don&#39;t change it to zero, other code could optimized based on the contradictory assumption that it is non-zero. Because instcombine aggressively folds operations with undef args anyway, this won&#39;t lose us code quality.

This function is defined on values with integer type, values with pointer type, and vectors of integers. In the case where V is a vector, known zero, and known one values are the same width as the vector element, and the bit is set only if it is true for all of the demanded elements in the vector specified by DemandedElts.

  labels = {["static"]}>
Compute known bits from a shift operator, including those with a non-constant shift amount.

Known is the output of this function. Known2 is a pre-allocated temporary with the same bit width as Known and on return contains the known bit of the shift value source. KF is an operator-specific function that, given the known-bits and a shift amount, compute the implied known-bits of the shift operator&#39;s result respectively for that shift amount. The results from calling KF are conservatively combined for all permitted shift amounts.

  labels = {["static"]}>
Return the number of times the sign bit of the register is replicated into the other bits.

We know that at least 1 bit is always equal to the sign bit (itself), but other cases can give us information. For example, immediately after an &quot;ashr X, 2&quot;, we know that the top 3 bits are all equal to each other, so we return 3. For vectors, return the number of sign bits for the vector element with the minimum number of known sign bits of the demanded elements in the vector specified by DemandedElts.

### lookThroughCast() {#a343ee023c7b7336ca66fd4c296db0feb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Value &#42; lookThroughCast (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst">CmpInst</a> &#42; CmpI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> &#42; CastOp)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Helps to match a select pattern in case of a type mismatch.

The function processes the case when type of true and false values of a select instruction differs from type of the cmp instruction operands because of a cast instruction. The function checks if it is legal to move the cast operation after &quot;select&quot;. If yes, it returns the new second value of &quot;select&quot; (with the assumption that cast is moved):
<ul>
<li>As operand of cast instruction when both values of &quot;select&quot; are same cast instructions.</li>
<li>As restored constant (by applying reverse cast operation) when the first value of the &quot;select&quot; is a cast operation and the second value is a constant. It is implemented in <a href="#a88b0909bfe0684c1c286237dd9985ce9">lookThroughCastConst()</a>.</li>
<li>As one operand is cast instruction and the other is not. The operands in sel(cmp) are in different type integer. NOTE: We return only the new second value because the first value could be accessed as operand of cast instruction.</li>
</ul>

<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are two restrictions on the use of an assume:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  1 The assume must dominate the context (or the control flow must</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     reach the assume whenever it reaches the context).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  2 The context must not be in the assume&#39;s set of ephemeral values</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     (otherwise we will use the assume to prove that the condition</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     feeding the assume is trivially true, thus causing the removal of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     the assume).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If Inv and CtxI are in the same block, check if the assume (Inv) is first</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in the BB.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Inv-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a784097fca76abad9e815cf1692de79c4">comesBefore</a>(CxtI))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t let an assume affect itself - this would cause the problems</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;isEphemeralValueOf&#96; is trying to prevent, and it would also make</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the loop below go out of bounds.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!AllowEphemerals &amp;&amp; Inv == CxtI)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The context comes first, but they&#39;re both in the same block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure there is nothing in between that might interrupt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the control flow, not even CxtI itself.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We limit the scan distance between the assume and its context instruction</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to avoid a compile-time explosion. This limit is chosen arbitrarily, so</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1332"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Known bits are automatically intersected across demanded elements of a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1334"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// zero across all demanded elements of the vector.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1335"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1336"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For this bitcast, each demanded element of the output is sub-divided</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1337"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// across a set of smaller vector elements in the source vector. To get</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1338"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the known bits for an entire element of the output, compute the known</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1339"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bits for each sub-element sequentially. This is done by shifting the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1340"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// one-set-bit demanded elements parameter across the sub-elements for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1341"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// consecutive calls to computeKnownBits. We are using the demanded</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1342"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// elements parameter as a mask operator.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1343"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1344"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The known bits of each sub-element are then inserted into place</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1345"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (dependent on endian) to form the full result of known bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1346"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumElts = DemandedElts.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a512fe2c15ea651294688eeec1341644c">getBitWidth</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2151"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Determine which bits of V are known to be either zero or one and return</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2154"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: we cannot consider &#39;undef&#39; to be &quot;IsZero&quot; here.  The problem is that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2155"><Highlight kind="comment">/// we cannot optimize based on the assumption that it is zero without changing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it to be an explicit zero.  If we don&#39;t change it to zero, other code could</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2157"><Highlight kind="comment">/// optimized based on the contradictory assumption that it is non-zero.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2158"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Because instcombine aggressively folds operations with undef args anyway,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2164"><Highlight kind="comment">/// same width as the vector element, and the bit is set only if it is true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2165"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for all of the demanded elements in the vector specified by DemandedElts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2954"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction::BitCast: &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2955"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We need to be a bit careful here. We can only peek through the bitcast</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2956"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// if the scalar size of elements in the operand are smaller than and a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2957"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multiple of the size they are casting too. Take three cases:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2958"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2959"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) Unsafe:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2960"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        bitcast &lt;2 x i16&gt; %NonZero to &lt;4 x i8&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2961"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2962"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    %NonZero can have 2 non-zero i16 elements, but isKnownNonZero on a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2963"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    &lt;4 x i8&gt; requires that all 4 i8 elements be non-zero which isn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2964"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    guranteed (imagine just sign bit set in the 2 i16 elements).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2965"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2966"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2) Unsafe:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2967"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        bitcast &lt;4 x i3&gt; %NonZero to &lt;3 x i4&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2968"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2969"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    Even though the scalar size of the src (&#96;i3&#96;) is smaller than the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2970"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    scalar size of the dst &#96;i4&#96;, because &#96;i3&#96; is not a multiple of &#96;i4&#96;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2971"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    its possible for the &#96;3 x i4&#96; elements to be zero because there are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2972"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    some elements in the destination that don&#39;t contain any full src</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2973"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    element.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2974"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2975"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3) Safe:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2976"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//        bitcast &lt;4 x i8&gt; %NonZero to &lt;2 x i16&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2977"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2978"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    This is always safe as non-zero in the 4 i8 elements implies</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2979"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    non-zero in the combination of any two adjacent ones. Since i8 is a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2980"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    multiple of i16, each i16 is guranteed to have 2 full i8 elements.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2981"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    This all implies the 2 i16 elements are non-zero.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2982"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;FromTy = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;getOperand(0)-&gt;getType();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2983"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((FromTy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a34ee40bb2f4f5ece47ef19e5f1f57e3c">isIntOrIntVectorTy</a>() || FromTy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#ab03652069eab17006c51f00c261a6a44">isPtrOrPtrVectorTy</a>()) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2984"><Highlight kind="normal">        (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a> % <a href="#a2cb59ea8f9e8543986d40c48acfd24a3">getBitWidth</a>(FromTy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type/#a7c742b32ebcd73d6dc851afac295b0f2">getScalarType</a>(), Q.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/simplifyquery/#a0ffb6d79f6befe2030328bd1d7110feb">DL</a>)) == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3959"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3960"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3961"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Calculate the incoming numerator bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3962"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumBits =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3963"><Highlight kind="normal">            <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad46ed333b920b20e78d948610366254c">ComputeNumSignBits</a>(U-&gt;getOperand(0), DemandedElts, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">Depth</a> + 1, Q);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3964"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3965"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Add floor(log(C)) bits to the numerator bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3966"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::min(TyBits, NumBits + Denominator-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aae3b959a0a2981340fd03c29f528f2f0">logBase2</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3975"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// srem X, C -&gt; we know that the result is within &#91;-C+1,C) when C is a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3976"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// positive constant.  This let us put a lower bound on the number of sign</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3977"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3978"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/patternmatch/#a25d956d9e0beadd47ce4bc255dfa811d">match</a>(U-&gt;getOperand(1), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/patternmatch/#aac9e78b3aa02ec087c4621358f506718">m&#95;APInt</a>(Denominator))) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3979"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3980"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ignore non-positive denominator.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3981"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Denominator-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#aa17c104fbda554c818cf87e53f32f20a">isStrictlyPositive</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3982"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Calculate the leading sign bit constraints by examining the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3983"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// denominator.  Given that the denominator is positive, there are two</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03984" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3984"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cases:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03985" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3985"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03986" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3986"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  1 The numerator is positive. The result range is &#91;0,C) and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03987" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3987"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     &#91;0,C) u&lt; (1 &lt;&lt; ceilLogBase2(C)).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03988" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3988"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3989"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  2 The numerator is negative. Then the result range is (-C,0&#93; and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3990"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     integers in (-C,0&#93; are either 0 or &gt;u (-1 &lt;&lt; ceilLogBase2(C)).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3991"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03992" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3992"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Thus a lower bound on the number of sign bits is &#96;TyBits -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3993"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ceilLogBase2(C)&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3994"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03995" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3995"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ResBits = TyBits - Denominator-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a392d67031c5429420ac0b46478fe893e">ceilLogBase2</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03996" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3996"><Highlight kind="normal">          Tmp = std::max(Tmp, ResBits);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03997" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3997"><Highlight kind="normal">        &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03998" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3998"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03999" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3999"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Tmp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l04041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4041"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Logical binary ops preserve the number of sign bits at the worst.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l04042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4042"><Highlight kind="normal">      Tmp = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad46ed333b920b20e78d948610366254c">ComputeNumSignBits</a>(U-&gt;getOperand(0), DemandedElts, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">Depth</a> + 1, Q);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l06358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6358"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#123; a, &#123; b, &#123; c, d &#125;, e &#125; &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6359"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and the indices &quot;1, 1&quot; this returns</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6360"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#123; c, d &#125;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6361"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l06362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6362"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It does this by inserting an insertvalue for each element in the resulting</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l07232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7232"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/simplifyquery">SimplifyQuery</a> &amp;SQ) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7233"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Multiplying n &#42; m significant bits yields a result of n + m significant</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7234"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// bits. If the total number of significant bits does not exceed the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// result bit width (minus 1), there is no overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This means if we have enough leading sign bits in the operands</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7237"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we can guarantee that the result does not overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7238"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ref: &quot;Hacker&#39;s Delight&quot; by Henry Warren</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>-&gt;getType()-&gt;getScalarSizeInBits();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7240"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7241"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that underestimating the number of sign bits gives a more</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// conservative answer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7243"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SignBits =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7244"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad46ed333b920b20e78d948610366254c">::ComputeNumSignBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, 0, SQ) + <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad46ed333b920b20e78d948610366254c">::ComputeNumSignBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>, 0, SQ);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7245"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7246"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First handle the easy case: if we have enough sign bits there&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7247"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// definitely no overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7248"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SignBits &gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a> + 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7249"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13a56624a95592b438e05ab500a6a200a03">OverflowResult::NeverOverflows</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7251"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are two ambiguous cases where there can be no overflow:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7252"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   SignBits == BitWidth + 1    and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7253"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   SignBits == BitWidth</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7254"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The second case is difficult to check, therefore we only handle the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7255"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// first case.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7256"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SignBits == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abee0df5f7f703bb4462aba260ba0a60f">BitWidth</a> + 1) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7257"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It overflows only when both arguments are negative and the true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7258"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// product is exactly the minimum negative number.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7259"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// E.g. mul i16 with 17 sign bits: 65280 &#42; 65408 = 32768</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7260"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For simplicity we just check if at least one side is not negative.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7261"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownbits">KnownBits</a> LHSKnown = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab2c2c51743fb4a1b17c59563909f3f24">computeKnownBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;Depth=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">0, SQ);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l07263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7263"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (LHSKnown.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownbits/#a157efd68e8b4b838829cad165b1583f8">isNonNegative</a>() || RHSKnown.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownbits/#a157efd68e8b4b838829cad165b1583f8">isNonNegative</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7264"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13a56624a95592b438e05ab500a6a200a03">OverflowResult::NeverOverflows</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l07287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7287"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7288"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If LHS and RHS each have at least two sign bits, the addition will look</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7289"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// like</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7290"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7291"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// XX..... +</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7292"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// YY.....</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7293"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7294"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the carry into the most significant position is 0, X and Y can&#39;t both</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7295"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be 1 and therefore the carry out of the addition is also 0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7296"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7297"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the carry into the most significant position is 1, X and Y can&#39;t both</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7298"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// be 0 and therefore the carry out of the addition is also 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7299"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7300"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since the carry into the most significant position is always equal to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7301"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the carry out of the addition, there is no signed overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7302"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad46ed333b920b20e78d948610366254c">::ComputeNumSignBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, 0, SQ) &gt; 1 &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7303"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad46ed333b920b20e78d948610366254c">::ComputeNumSignBits</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>, 0, SQ) &gt; 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l07304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7304"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13a56624a95592b438e05ab500a6a200a03">OverflowResult::NeverOverflows</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l07879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7879"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if undefined behavior would provably be executed on the path to</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l08947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8947"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %cond = cmp iN %x, CmpConst</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8948"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %tr = trunc iN %x to iK</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8949"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %narrowsel = select i1 %cond, iK %t, iK C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8950"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8951"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can always move trunc after select operation:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8952"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8953"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %cond = cmp iN %x, CmpConst</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8954"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %widesel = select i1 %cond, iN %x, iN CmpConst</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8955"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   %tr = trunc iN %widesel to iK</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8956"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8957"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that C could be extended in any way because we don&#39;t care about</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8958"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// upper bits after truncation. It can&#39;t be abs pattern, because it would</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8959"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// look like:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8960"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8961"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   select i1 %cond, x, -x.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8962"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8963"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// So only min/max pattern could be matched. Such match requires widened C</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l08964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8964"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// == CmpConst. That is why set widened C = CmpConst, condition trunc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l09005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9005"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9006"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Helps to match a select pattern in case of a type mismatch.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9007"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9008"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The function processes the case when type of true and false values of a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9009"><Highlight kind="comment">/// select instruction differs from type of the cmp instruction operands because</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9010"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of a cast instruction. The function checks if it is legal to move the cast</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9011"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operation after &quot;select&quot;. If yes, it returns the new second value of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9012"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &quot;select&quot; (with the assumption that cast is moved):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9013"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 1 As operand of cast instruction when both values of &quot;select&quot; are same cast</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9014"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9015"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 2 As restored constant (by applying reverse cast operation) when the first</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9016"><Highlight kind="comment">/// value of the &quot;select&quot; is a cast operation and the second value is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9017"><Highlight kind="comment">/// constant. It is implemented in lookThroughCastConst().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9018"><Highlight kind="comment">/// 3 As one operand is cast instruction and the other is not. The operands in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9019"><Highlight kind="comment">/// sel(cmp) are in different type integer.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9020"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: We return only the new second value because the first value could be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9021"><Highlight kind="comment">/// accessed as operand of cast instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
